description: Warning: Fake North Face sites (e.g., 'northfaceblackfriday.shop') use fake deals to steal credit card info.
how to spot it: Verify URLs (no typos/odd extensions). Huge discounts or urgent language = red flag.

description: Alert: Instagram ads push fake Nike sites with huge discounts (e.g., 80% off) to steal payment info or send knock-offs.
how to spot it: Check profile/URL (must link to nike.com). Unbelievable deals are likely scams.

description: Watch Out: Emails saying 'Amazon Order Hold' or 'Account Issue' link to fake logins to steal your credentials.
how to spot it: Check sender (must be @amazon.com). When unsure, log in directly via browser/app.

description: Beware: Fake Walmart gift card giveaways on Facebook lead to scam survey sites stealing data or demanding fees.
how to spot it: Verify on official Walmart channels. Giveaways needing fees or too much info are red flags.

description: Alert: Texts like 'Chase: Unusual Activity' link to fake logins to steal your banking credentials.
how to spot it: Texts only from verified codes. Log in via official site/app, not unknown links.

description: Warning: Calls pretending to be BofA fraud team pressure you to transfer funds to a 'safe' (scammer's) account.
how to spot it: BofA never pressures fund transfers via phone. Hang up, call the official number on their site/your card.

description: Watch Out: Emails claiming 'Wells Fargo Account Locked' use fake links to steal your login info.
how to spot it: Check sender (@wellsfargo.com). Suspicious link? Log in directly on the official site.

description: Alert: Emails warning 'PayPal Account Limitation' link to fake logins designed to steal your credentials.
how to spot it: Real emails use your name & come from PayPal addresses. Never click links; log in directly.

description: Warning: Fake 'Microsoft Virus' pop-ups demand you call 'support'. Calling leads to remote access scams/malware.
how to spot it: Real alerts are in OS/updates, not pop-ups forcing calls. Close pop-up, run trusted antivirus.

description: Beware: Calls claiming to be Apple Support about 'compromised iCloud' demand gift cards or fake app installs.
how to spot it: Apple never calls unsolicited or demands gift cards/app installs. Hang up, call official support.

description: Alert: Fake Google recruiters on LinkedIn offer quick jobs via brief interviews to steal personal info.
how to spot it: Google hiring is thorough, not casual messages. Verify recruiters on official Google careers page.

description: Watch Out: Texts offering Costco WFH jobs demand fees for 'training/shipping', then vanish with your money.
how to spot it: Costco never texts job offers or asks for upfront fees. Verify offers via official Costco site.

description: Beware: Emails offering Amazon remote jobs ask for 'training fees' or bank details upfront, then disappear.
how to spot it: Real Amazon jobs via careers portal; never require upfront payment. WFH jobs asking for money = red flag.

description: Warning: Dating app scammers posing as deployed U.S. Army officers invent fake emergencies to ask for money.
how to spot it: Financial requests from unmet online contacts = red flag. Real military won't ask for cash on dating apps.

description: Alert: Facebook Dating scammers (e.g., 'widowed engineer on oil rig') invent crises to ask you for money.
how to spot it: Match avoids video calls then asks for money = red flag. Verify identity via live chat first.

description: Beware: Dating app contacts brag of Coinbase crypto gains, push quick investments using fake dashboards.
how to spot it: High-pressure investment pitches from new online contacts = red flag. Don't let romance cloud judgment.

description: Watch Out: Texts claiming 'USPS Delivery Issue' demand small fees via links to fake sites that steal card info.
how to spot it: USPS never texts demanding immediate payment. Use official tracking or call post office.

description: Alert: Emails about 'FedEx Missed Delivery' link to fake sites designed to steal personal/financial info.
how to spot it: Check sender (must be @fedex.com). Urgent email? Log in directly to FedEx site, don't click links.

description: Warning: Calls/emails pretending to be IRS demand immediate payment (gift card/wire) for fake back taxes.
how to spot it: IRS uses mail, never demands immediate electronic payment. Verify directly with IRS official contacts.

description: Watch Out: Emails claiming 'Xfinity Payment Failed' link to fake logins to steal credentials/billing info.
how to spot it: Check sender (official Xfinity address). Urgent email? Log in directly via site/app or call Xfinity.
